11.speaker: Player
11.text: The githyanki are leaving. It would have been hard to imagine parting ways from them peacefully, once...

103.speaker: Player
103.text: The githyanki are leaving. It would have been hard to imagine parting ways from them peacefully, once...

111.speaker: Player
111.text: The githyanki are leaving. It would have been hard to imagine parting ways from them peacefully, once...

144.speaker: Player
144.text: The githyanki are leaving. It would have been hard to imagine parting ways from them peacefully, once...

72.text: The githyanki are leaving. It would have been hard to imagine parting ways from them peacefully, once...

101.speaker: Player
101.text: The githyanki are leaving. It would have been hard to imagine parting ways from them peacefully, once...
101.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Reflecting on her much earlier antagonism towards the githyanki

118.speaker: Player
118.text: The githyanki are leaving. It would have been hard to imagine parting ways from them peacefully, once...
118.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Reflecting on her much earlier antagonism towards the githyanki

132.speaker: Shadowheart
132.text: The githyanki are leaving. It would have been hard to imagine parting ways from them peacefully, once...
132.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful. Reflecting on her much earlier antagonism towards the githyanki

112.speaker: Shadowheart
112.text: So. Lae'zel. Will you be joining them?
112.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

66.speaker: Player
66.text: *The time has come. You may be an illithid, but you thwarted the Grand Design. Perhaps your Queen may yet ascend you for your deeds alone?*
66.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon flies to Lae'zel. She mounts itInternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated, not ceremorphed Laezel Avatar

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *The time has come. You have thwarted the Grand Design. You can call out to the Astral - and ascend.*
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon flies to Lae'zel. She mounts itInternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated, not ceremorphed Laezel Avatar

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Speak the Rite of Ascension. Vlaakith, ik sa'ith. Vlaakith, tri na'sa'zhi!
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon flies to Lae'zel. She mounts itInternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated, not ceremorphed Laezel Avatar

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *A pocket of psionic energy reaches out from your mind to the Astral Plane. Your plea has been heard.*
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon flies to Lae'zel. She mounts itInternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated, not ceremorphed Laezel Avatar

104.speaker: Narrator
104.text: *The red dragon appears, poised to carry you to Tu'narath. The queen's covenant is fulfilled at last.*
104.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon flies to Lae'zel. She mounts itInternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated, not ceremorphed Laezel Avatar

146.text: Is this farewell then? I'm glad we didn't end up killing each other - things would have been much duller, I'm sure.

97.speaker: Shadowheart
97.text: Is this farewell then? I'm glad we didn't end up killing each other - things would have been much duller, I'm sure.

174.speaker: Narrator
174.text: *You shiver, perhaps out of fear, excitement, elation - or all three.*
174.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel flies off on the dragon and the scene is over.InternalNodeContext: Lae'zel flies off, never to be seen again.

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *In the distant reaches of your mind, Vlaakith calls out her eternal promise. You will know the names of the stars and the will of the cosmos. You will ascend.*
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel flies off on the dragon and the scene is over.InternalNodeContext: Lae'zel flies off, never to be seen again.

27.speaker: Narrator
27.text: *There is a great pause, as if the entire universe had gone quiet - and you know the truth.*

47.speaker: Narrator
47.text: *You appear as an illithid. The kith'raki will hunt you, gut you, and devour you. You are not Vlaakith's precious, but Vlaakith's prey.*

153.speaker: Narrator
153.text: *You are what you were taught to hate. The next choice is yours, and yours alone.*
153.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Even without your queen's blessing, you have earned the right to survive.
115.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *You have thwarted the illithid Grand Design. You have honoured your people, you have secured their future. Your duty is fulfilled.*

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text: *Your fate will be what you make of it. Now, you are your own master.*

130.speaker: Player
130.text: You will not live as your queen's reject. Take your own life.
130.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party

119.speaker: Player
119.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party

133.speaker: Shadowheart
133.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party

19.speaker: Astarion
19.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted. She's about to kill herself in front of the party

108.speaker: Astarion
108.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, She's about to kill herself in front of the party

28.speaker: Wyll
28.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party

123.speaker: Gale
123.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party. Urgent from Gale - sees what she's about to do.

5.speaker: Minsc
5.context: NodeContext: Sudden shock as you watch Lae'zel kill herself after the battle rather than become a mind flayer

24.speaker: Jaheira
24.context: NodeContext: Sudden shock as you watch Lae'zel kill herself after the battle rather than become a mind flayer

16.speaker: Minsc
16.context: NodeContext: Sudden shock as you watch Lae'zel kill herself after the battle rather than become a mind flayer

160.speaker: Karlach
160.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party

155.speaker: Halsin
155.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party

36.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
36.text: Lae'zel, no! You are destined for great things, child!
36.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party

122.speaker: Karlach
122.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel failed to ascend, which is all she's ever wanted, and kills herself in front of the party

10.speaker: The Emperor
10.text: I suppose I should have foreseen this...
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel illithid player guts herself with a dagger as her companions look on in horror. The epilogue will go on without her.

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *The blade feels cool as it pierces your flesh. There is no pain, only the need to sleep... sleep... sleep...*
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'zel illithid player guts herself with a dagger as her companions look on in horror. The epilogue will go on without her.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: You need no one's blessing now. You have destroyed a Netherbrain. You will thrive.

90.text: *The world is yours for the taking. A world you have made your own.*

96.speaker: Narrator
96.text: *The world is yours for the taking. A world you have made your own.*

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *Vlaakith has rejected you, for Orpheus still lives. The kith'raki will hunt you, gut you, and devour you. You are not Vlaakith's precious, but Vlaakith's prey.*

161.speaker: Narrator
161.text: *Your fate belongs to you, and you alone. What will you make of it?*

151.speaker: Player
151.text: You have found affection and more on this rock. Stay, and pursue a new life.

9.text: *Vlaakith will call for your head and send the kith'raki. They will chase you to the ends of the many planes.*

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *Vlaakith will call for your head and send the kith'raki. They will chase you to the ends of the many planes.*

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *But you feel secure in your fate. You know there is something beyond ascension - companionship.*

6.speaker: Shadowheart
6.text: I suspected you wouldn't be able to part from me. Looks like I was right.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: You have seen through Vlaakith's lies. Turn your back on your queen.

139.speaker: Narrator
139.text: *But you are now your own master. The world is yours for the taking. A world of countless possibilities.*

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Vlaakith will reject your illithid form. Brace for a future beyond your queen.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: You have made allies and friends. Remain in Faerûn.

56.speaker: Lae'zel
56.text: The Netherbrain is dead. To slay a ghaik was my sworn duty. I must call out to Tu'narath - my ascension's at hand.
56.context: CinematicNodeContext: |A dragon flies in. Lae'zel and the player mount it.|InternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated

158.speaker: Player
158.text: I will join you. We triumphed together - I have earned the right.
158.context: CinematicNodeContext: |A dragon flies in. Lae'zel and the player mount it.|InternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated

65.speaker: Lae'zel
65.text: So you have. Now focus your mind, hear my words. I will speak the Rite.
65.context: CinematicNodeContext: |A dragon flies in. Lae'zel and the player mount it.|InternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated

109.speaker: Narrator
109.text: *A pocket of psionic energy reaches out from your mind to the Astral Plane. Lae'zel has spoken - and been heard.*
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: |A dragon flies in. Lae'zel and the player mount it.|InternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated

14.speaker: Lae'zel
14.text: Red dragons, to carry us to Tu'narath. The queen's covenant is fulfilled!
14.context: CinematicNodeContext: |A dragon flies in. Lae'zel and the player mount it.|InternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated

166.text: Come. The dragons will know the way.
166.context: CinematicNodeContext: |The player and Lae'zel fly off on the dragon and the scene ends.|InternalNodeContext: The player and Lae'zel fly off on their dragons, never to be seen again.

69.speaker: Lae'zel
69.text: Come. The dragons will know the way.
69.context: CinematicNodeContext: |The player and Lae'zel fly off on the dragon and the scene ends.|InternalNodeContext: The player and Lae'zel fly off on their dragons, never to be seen again.

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: *You shiver, perhaps out of fear, excitement, elation - or all three.*
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: |The player and Lae'zel fly off on the dragon and the scene ends.|InternalNodeContext: The player and Lae'zel fly off on their dragons, never to be seen again.

106.speaker: Narrator
106.text: *In the distant reaches of your mind, Vlaakith calls out her eternal promise. You will know the names of the stars and the will of the cosmos. You will ascend.*
106.context: CinematicNodeContext: |The player and Lae'zel fly off on the dragon and the scene ends.|InternalNodeContext: The player and Lae'zel fly off on their dragons, never to be seen again.

175.speaker: Narrator
175.text: *There is a great pause, as if the entire universe had gone quiet - and the connection is severed. Lae'zel has failed Vlaakith; you will not ascend.*

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Ascend, Lae'zel. Fulfil your duty to Vlaakith.
43.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith bah na-ZIN. VLAH-kith ik sah-ITH. VLAH-kith try na-sa-ZHEE! (Vlaakith, I seek truth. Vlaakith, grant me entry. Vlaakith, ascend me!)

41.speaker: Lae'zel
41.text: Bah - you would deny Vlaakith's gift? Very well - while you fumble about on this rock, I will raise a silver sword in my queen's honour!

143.speaker: Player
143.text: What makes you so sure Vlaakith will welcome you?
143.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith bah na-ZIN. VLAH-kith ik sah-ITH. VLAH-kith try na-sa-ZHEE! (Vlaakith, I seek truth. Vlaakith, grant me entry. Vlaakith, ascend me!)

91.speaker: Lae'zel
91.text: We have thwarted the Grand Design, and I have slain the traitor prince. My loyalty is beyond question.

162.speaker: Lae'zel
162.text: Silence now. I will speak the Rite of Ascension.

152.speaker: Lae'zel
152.text: We have thwarted the Grand Design. My loyalty is beyond question.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Forget ascension. Stay here. Make your own way as your own master.
117.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith bah na-ZIN. VLAH-kith ik sah-ITH. VLAH-kith try na-sa-ZHEE! (Vlaakith, I seek truth. Vlaakith, grant me entry. Vlaakith, ascend me!)

88.speaker: Lae'zel
88.text: I've suffered so many bruises, bore so many blows, all to earn Vlaakith's favour.
88.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith bah na-ZIN. VLAH-kith ik sah-ITH. VLAH-kith try na-sa-ZHEE! (Vlaakith, I seek truth. Vlaakith, grant me entry. Vlaakith, ascend me!)

38.speaker: Lae'zel
38.text: I've suffered so many bruises, bore so many blows, all to earn Vlaakith's favour.

26.speaker: Lae'zel
26.text: Yet it's this vexing, excruciating, phenomenal world that I can't resist.

165.speaker: Lae'zel
165.text: Vlaakith will call for my head. The kith'raki will chase me to every corner of Toril.

173.speaker: Lae'zel
173.text: Let them. Now, I hunt prey on my own terms and spill blood of my choosing. I need not be ascended - for I am born anew.

107.text: My purpose was ordained before I hatched. Vlaakith is the wind that bears me and the fire that warms me.
107.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith bah na-ZIN. VLAH-kith ik sah-ITH. VLAH-kith try na-sa-ZHEE! (Vlaakith, I seek truth. Vlaakith, grant me entry. Vlaakith, ascend me!)

1.speaker: Lae'zel
1.text: My purpose was ordained before I hatched. Vlaakith is the wind that bears me and the fire that warms me.
1.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith bah na-ZIN. VLAH-kith ik sah-ITH. VLAH-kith try na-sa-ZHEE! (Vlaakith, I seek truth. Vlaakith, grant me entry. Vlaakith, ascend me!)

78.speaker: Lae'zel
78.text: You are an honourable ally. I thought I would carry you. In truth, you oft carried me. I won't forget it.
78.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith bah na-ZIN. VLAH-kith ik sah-ITH. VLAH-kith try na-sa-ZHEE! (Vlaakith, I seek truth. Vlaakith, grant me entry. Vlaakith, ascend me!)

18.speaker: Lae'zel
18.text: Silence, now. I will speak the Rite.
18.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith bah na-ZIN. VLAH-kith ik sah-ITH. VLAH-kith try na-sa-ZHEE! (Vlaakith, I seek truth. Vlaakith, grant me entry. Vlaakith, ascend me!)

62.speaker: Lae'zel
62.text: Vlaakith, ba na'zin. Vlaakith, ik sa'ith. Vlaakith, tri na'sa'zhi!
62.context: NodeContext: VLAH-kith bah na-ZIN. VLAH-kith ik sah-ITH. VLAH-kith try na-sa-ZHEE! (Vlaakith, I seek truth. Vlaakith, grant me entry. Vlaakith, ascend me!)

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: *You quiver in spite of yourself. Lae'zel's shouts to the Astral Plane, seeking an answer. And before long, she has one.*
3.context: InternalNodeContext: Orpheus defeated and Lae'zel not ceremo

134.speaker: Lae'zel
134.text: A red dragon, to carry me to Tu'narath. The queen's covenant is fulfilled!
134.context: CinematicNodeContext: |A dragons flies in. Lae'zel mounts it.|InternalNodeContext: Orpheus is defeated

75.text: *You look on as Lae'zel soars to an uncertain fate.*
75.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Lae'zel flies off on her dragon|

82.speaker: Narrator
82.text: *You look on as Lae'zel soars to an uncertain fate.*
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Lae'zel flies off on her dragon|

138.speaker: Narrator
138.text: *The air around you is eerily still, as if time itself had been momentarily stopped.*
138.context: NodeContext: More urgently this time. VLAH-kith bah na-ZIN. VLAH-kith ik sah-ITH. VLAH-kith try na-sa-ZHEE! (Vlaakith, I seek truth. Vlaakith, grant me entry. Vlaakith, ascend me!)

86.speaker: Lae'zel
86.text: Hear me, my queen! Vlaakith, ba na'zin. Vlaakith, ik sa'ith. Vlaakith, tri na'sa'zhi!
86.context: NodeContext: More urgently this time. VLAH-kith bah na-ZIN. VLAH-kith ik sah-ITH. VLAH-kith try na-sa-ZHEE! (Vlaakith, I seek truth. Vlaakith, grant me entry. Vlaakith, ascend me!)

0.speaker: Narrator
0.context: NodeContext: The most crushed she has ever been. Vlaakith has refused her ascension.

60.speaker: Lae'zel
60.text: No, no, no! My Queen, I am worthy! Do not throw me into the darkness - I would see your face and know your light!
60.context: NodeContext: The most crushed she has ever been. Vlaakith has refused her ascension.

48.speaker: Lae'zel
48.text: Orpheus lives. Vlaakith has rejected me. I am Hshar'lak.
48.context: NodeContext: The most crushed she has ever been. Vlaakith has refused her ascension. h-SHAR-lock. (Traitor)

42.speaker: Lae'zel
42.text: I appear as an illithid. Vlaakith has rejected me. I am Hshar'lak.

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *A moment passes. Lae'zel's heat turns to ice.*

83.speaker: Lae'zel
83.text: The kith'raki will chase me to each end of the Material Plane. I have no ally but my own blade.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: You also have me. That must count for something.

157.speaker: Lae'zel
157.text: Gith's spirit help me, but it does. We have thwarted the ghaik Grand Design. I have honoured my people, I have secured their future. My duty is fulfilled.

137.speaker: Player
137.text: You can make a home in Faerûn. The githyanki are not unknown in Baldur's Gate.

35.speaker: Lae'zel
35.text: Perhaps, once it's recovered from the Netherbrain's scourge. I could find allies here, at very least.

54.speaker: Lae'zel
54.text: I have thwarted the ghaik Grand Design. I have honoured my people, I have secured their future. our duty is fulfilled.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: Good luck. Sounds like you'll need it.

116.speaker: Lae'zel
116.text: A warrior never depends on luck - she depends on skill. And maybe a few good allies to keep her honest.

95.speaker: Lae'zel
95.text: I hope I can count you in that number.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Dammit all, Lae'zel. How dare you get me punished for your misdeeds?

136.speaker: Lae'zel
136.text: The queen's decision is made, and our fates are open. Gnash your teeth, shake your head, grunt all you want.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: We're all the better for it. Vlaakith is a liar and a slaver. She is not the way forward.

70.speaker: Lae'zel
70.text: Our way forward is open, true.

181.speaker: Lae'zel
181.text: We have thwarted the ghaik Grand Design. We have honoured our people, we have secured their future. Our duty is fulfilled.

167.speaker: Lae'zel
167.text: The past is done, and we face the future. Apart, we can survive. Together we can thrive.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Forget ascension. Stay here. Make your own way as your own master.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Forget ascension. Stay in Faerûn, with me.

102.speaker: Lae'zel
102.text: I saw something more for us, once. But you are ghaik. My path cannot be yours.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: Forget ascension. Stay here, with the one you care for.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: This is your decision, Lae'zel. Make it count.

76.speaker: Lae'zel
76.text: Then we will ascend to the Astral Plane together. Now focus your mind, hear my words. I will speak the Rite.

125.speaker: Lae'zel
125.text: You are right. My choice, my life. I will know true liberation.

44.speaker: Astarion
44.text: Well that's a pleasant sight. Here's hoping they stay in their own plane.
44.context: NodeContext: [Arrogant Astarion] Watching dragons fly off, through a portal back to the Astral plane

129.speaker: Astarion
129.text: Speaking of the Astral Plane - aren't you going to join them, Lae'zel?
129.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

30.speaker: Astarion
30.text: Now there's a sight to see. Not that I'll miss them... No offence.
30.context: NodeContext: [Good(er) Path Astarion] Watching dragons fly off, through a portal back to the Astral plane

113.speaker: Astarion
113.text: Speaking of githyanki, will you be joining them, Lae'zel?
113.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

39.speaker: Wyll
39.text: The githyanki are leaving us. An unlikely place to find ourselves, fighting on the same side as them.
39.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

178.speaker: Wyll
178.text: Speaking of githyanki, what will you do now, Lae'zel? Will you join them?
178.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

140.speaker: Gale
140.text: The githyanki are departing in peace. A curious sight in a day already full of them.
140.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

156.speaker: Gale
156.text: Speaking of githyanki, what about you Lae'zel? Will you be joining them?
156.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

7.speaker: Halsin
7.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

141.speaker: Halsin
141.text: Lae'zel, will you be joining them?
141.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

169.speaker: Jaheira
169.text: A reprieve from the githyanki invasion - for this day, at least.
169.context: NodeContext: Watching githyanki rise and leave the city on their dragons

176.speaker: Jaheira
176.text: But what about you, Lae'zel, what will you do?
176.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

81.speaker: Minsc
81.text: See how the dragons flee you, Boo? Now they know you stand as this plane's protector.
81.context: NodeContext: Watching githyanki rise and leave the city on their dragons

25.speaker: Minsc
25.text: But Lae'zel is still here. Will you not join them?
25.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

128.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
128.text: The githyanki leave, at last. I feared they would make this world their own.
128.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

170.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
170.text: Will you go with them, Lae'zel? You would surely be heralded as a champion of your kind.
170.context: NodeContext: addressing player Lae'zel, wondering whether she will leave with her people or not

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: Goodbye, dragon riders. I wish you the best - in your home plane, preferably.
2.context: NodeContext: wistful farewell as the githyanki leave this world to go back to their home in the Astral Seas

61.speaker: Karlach
61.text: What about you though, Lae'zel? What's your plan?
